index.html
表型数据整理 Chapter 1 About 1.1 Usage 1.2 Render book 1.3 Preview book

表型数据整理 wy 2024-03-18 Chapter 1 About This is a sample book written in Markdown. You can use anything that Pandoc’s Markdown supports; for example, a math equation \(a^2 + b^2 = c^2\). 1.1 Usage Each bookdown chapter is an .Rmd file, and each .Rmd file can contain one (and only one) chapter. A chapter must start with a first-level heading: # A good chapter, and can contain one (and only one) first-level heading. Use second-level and higher headings within chapters like: ## A short section or ### An even shorter section. The index.Rmd file is required, and is also your first book chapter. It will be the homepage when you render the book. 1.2 Render book You can render the HTML version of this example book without changing anything: Find the Build pane in the RStudio IDE, and Click on Build Book, then select your output format, or select “All formats” if you’d like to use multiple formats from the same book source files. Or build the book from the R console: bookdown::render_book() To render this example to PDF as a bookdown::pdf_book, you’ll need to install XeLaTeX. You are recommended to install TinyTeX (which includes XeLaTeX): https://yihui.org/tinytex/. 1.3 Preview book As you work, you may start a local server to live preview this HTML book. This preview will update as you edit the book when you save individual .Rmd files. You can start the server in a work session by using the RStudio add-in “Preview book”, or from the R console: bookdown::serve_book()
hello-bookdown.html
Chapter 2 Hello bookdown 2.1 A section

Chapter 2 Hello bookdown All chapters start with a first-level heading followed by your chapter title, like the line above. There should be only one first-level heading (#) per .Rmd file. 2.1 A section All chapter sections start with a second-level (##) or higher heading followed by your section title, like the sections above and below here. You can have as many as you want within a chapter. An unnumbered section Chapters and sections are numbered by default. To un-number a heading, add a {.unnumbered} or the shorter {-} at the end of the heading, like in this section.
cross.html
Chapter 3 Cross-references 3.1 Chapters and sub-chapters 3.2 Captioned figures and tables

Chapter 3 Cross-references Cross-references make it easier for your readers to find and link to elements in your book. 3.1 Chapters and sub-chapters There are two steps to cross-reference any heading: Label the heading: # Hello world {#nice-label}. Leave the label off if you like the automated heading generated based on your heading title: for example, # Hello world = # Hello world {#hello-world}. To label an un-numbered heading, use: # Hello world {-#nice-label} or {# Hello world .unnumbered}. Next, reference the labeled heading anywhere in the text using \@ref(nice-label); for example, please see Chapter 3. If you prefer text as the link instead of a numbered reference use: any text you want can go here. 3.2 Captioned figures and tables Figures and tables with captions can also be cross-referenced from elsewhere in your book using \@ref(fig:chunk-label) and \@ref(tab:chunk-label), respectively. See Figure 3.1. par(mar = c(4, 4, .1, .1)) plot(pressure, type = 'b', pch = 19) Figure 3.1: Here is a nice figure! Don’t miss Table 3.1. knitr::kable( head(pressure, 10), caption = 'Here is a nice table!', booktabs = TRUE ) Table 3.1: Here is a nice table! temperature pressure 0 0.0002 20 0.0012 40 0.0060 60 0.0300 80 0.0900 100 0.2700 120 0.7500 140 1.8500 160 4.2000 180 8.8000
parts.html
Chapter 4 Parts

Chapter 4 Parts You can add parts to organize one or more book chapters together. Parts can be inserted at the top of an .Rmd file, before the first-level chapter heading in that same file. Add a numbered part: # (PART) Act one {-} (followed by # A chapter) Add an unnumbered part: # (PART\*) Act one {-} (followed by # A chapter) Add an appendix as a special kind of un-numbered part: # (APPENDIX) Other stuff {-} (followed by # A chapter). Chapters in an appendix are prepended with letters instead of numbers.
footnotes-and-citations.html
Chapter 5 Footnotes and citations 5.1 Footnotes 5.2 Citations

Chapter 5 Footnotes and citations 5.1 Footnotes Footnotes are put inside the square brackets after a caret ^[]. Like this one 1. 5.2 Citations Reference items in your bibliography file(s) using @key. For example, we are using the bookdown package (Xie 2024) (check out the last code chunk in index.Rmd to see how this citation key was added) in this sample book, which was built on top of R Markdown and knitr (Xie 2015) (this citation was added manually in an external file book.bib). Note that the .bib files need to be listed in the index.Rmd with the YAML bibliography key. The RStudio Visual Markdown Editor can also make it easier to insert citations: https://rstudio.github.io/visual-markdown-editing/#/citations References
blocks.html
Chapter 6 Blocks 6.1 Equations 6.2 Theorems and proofs 6.3 Callout blocks

Chapter 6 Blocks 6.1 Equations Here is an equation. \[\begin{equation} f\left(k\right) = \binom{n}{k} p^k\left(1-p\right)^{n-k} \tag{6.1} \end{equation}\] You may refer to using \@ref(eq:binom), like see Equation (6.1). 6.2 Theorems and proofs Labeled theorems can be referenced in text using \@ref(thm:tri), for example, check out this smart theorem 6.1. Theorem 6.1 For a right triangle, if \(c\) denotes the length of the hypotenuse and \(a\) and \(b\) denote the lengths of the other two sides, we have \[a^2 + b^2 = c^2\] Read more here https://bookdown.org/yihui/bookdown/markdown-extensions-by-bookdown.html. 6.3 Callout blocks The R Markdown Cookbook provides more help on how to use custom blocks to design your own callouts: https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown-cookbook/custom-blocks.html
sharing-your-book.html
Chapter 7 Sharing your book 7.1 Publishing 7.2 404 pages 7.3 Metadata for sharing

Chapter 7 Sharing your book 7.1 Publishing HTML books can be published online, see: https://bookdown.org/yihui/bookdown/publishing.html 7.2 404 pages By default, users will be directed to a 404 page if they try to access a webpage that cannot be found. If you’d like to customize your 404 page instead of using the default, you may add either a _404.Rmd or _404.md file to your project root and use code and/or Markdown syntax. 7.3 Metadata for sharing Bookdown HTML books will provide HTML metadata for social sharing on platforms like Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn, using information you provide in the index.Rmd YAML. To setup, set the url for your book and the path to your cover-image file. Your book’s title and description are also used. This gitbook uses the same social sharing data across all chapters in your book- all links shared will look the same. Specify your book’s source repository on GitHub using the edit key under the configuration options in the _output.yml file, which allows users to suggest an edit by linking to a chapter’s source file. Read more about the features of this output format here: https://pkgs.rstudio.com/bookdown/reference/gitbook.html Or use: ?bookdown::gitbook

Chapter 8 ABCD 非影像数据整理 8.1 R包 8.2 fund setup 8.3 mental health

Chapter 8 ABCD 非影像数据整理 8.1 R包 library(knitr) library(tidyverse) #数据处理 library(data.table) #数据处理 library(here) #路径设置 library(nlme) #线性混合效应模型 library(geepack) # 广义估计方程 8.2 fund setup library(knitr) knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE) knitr::opts_chunk$set( warning = FALSE, message = FALSE) setwd ## function (dir) ## .Internal(setwd(dir)) ## <bytecode: 0x000001f1ea96f488> ## <environment: namespace:base> wd <- c("C:/wy/abcd/") sub_id <- fread(here(wd,"temp/4年随访皮层厚度.csv")) %>% select(src_subject_id) %>% unique() # 2631 8.3 mental health 8.3.1 衡量精神病早期风险指标 # 衡量精神病早期风险指标 summary score annually since baseline mhy_pps_severity_mean_score <- fread(here(wd,"datas/5.1/core/mental-health/mh_y_pps.csv")) names(mhy_pps_severity_mean_score) # 均数标准差 mhy_pps_severity_mean_score %>% group_by(eventname) %>% summarise(mean = mean(pps_ss_mean_severity,na.rm = T), sd = sd(pps_ss_mean_severity,na.rm = T)) # 连续5年评分均值，逐年降低趋势？？？ mhy_pps_severity_mean_score %>% select(src_subject_id, eventname, pps_ss_mean_severity,pps_y_ss_severity_score) %>% filter(eventname %in% c("baseline_year_1_arm_1", "2_year_follow_up_y_arm_1", "4_year_follow_up_y_arm_1")) %>% filter(src_subject_id %in% sub_id$src_subject_id) %>% # 2631 fwrite(here(wd,"temp/mhy_pps_severity_mean_score.csv")) severity_mean_score <- fread(here(wd,"temp/mhy_pps_severity_mean_score.csv")) names(severity_mean_score) severity_mean_score %>% group_by(eventname) %>% summarise(mean = mean(pps_ss_mean_severity,na.rm = T), sd = sd(pps_ss_mean_severity,na.rm = T)) # 2631 fread(here(wd,"temp/4年随访皮层厚度.csv")) %>% left_join(severity_mean_score,by=c("src_subject_id","eventname")) %>% select(src_subject_id,eventname,sex,interview_age, pps_ss_mean_severity,smri_thick_cdk_mean) %>% mutate(id = as.integer(factor(src_subject_id,levels=unique(src_subject_id))), gender = as.integer(factor(sex,levels=unique(sex))), ctv = smri_thick_cdk_mean, age = interview_age/12, score = scale(pps_ss_mean_severity)) %>% drop_na() %>% group_by(id) %>% filter(n() == 3) ->r # 1572 人太少 mlm_fit <- nlme::lme(ctv ~ age + gender + score + age:score, random = ~ 1 | id, method = "ML", data = r, control = lmeControl(opt = "optim")) mlm_fit summary(mlm_fit) cor(r$ctv, r$score) ggplot(r, aes(x = score, y = ctv, color = score)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) + facet_wrap(~gender) # 非常不显著 并且缺失值过多 8.3.2 The Adverse Life Events Scale生活事件量表(分好坏) 一般分析不良事件和精神疾病的关联 Spearman 相关 Multivariate Logistic Regression （分男女） 协变量：age SES 剩余不良事件累计效应 种族 # Annually since 1-year follow-up 报告过去一年 mhy_les_score <- fread(here(wd, "datas/5.1/core/mental-health/mh_y_le.csv")) names(mhy_les_score) # 获取ple_y_ss_total_number_nm 不等于 0 对应的src_subject_id mhy_les_score %>% filter(ple_y_ss_total_number_nm != 0) %>% select(src_subject_id) %>% unique() -> les_id mhy_les_score %>% filter(!src_subject_id %in% les_id$src_subject_id) -> mhy_les_score # across 函数对列名包含'fu' 的列求和 mhy_les_score %>% summarise(sum = across(contains("_fu_"), ~sum(.x == 1 | .x == 2, na.rm = T)), sum_good = across(contains("_fu_"), ~sum(.x == 1, na.rm = T)), sum_bad = across(contains("_fu_"), ~sum(.x == 2, na.rm = T))) -> les_sum # 删掉item中回答好坏事件回答太少的人 how to define too few? # 精神疾病关联分析 多元逻辑回归 8.3.3 UPPS 衡量冲动行为的一种自我报告问卷 紧迫性（Urgency）、预谋（Premeditation）、毅力（Perseverance）、求刺激（Sensation Seeking）和积极紧迫性（Positive Urgency） 评估个体在不同情境下的冲动倾向以及行为控制能力 # Summary Score(s) Baseline 2-year follow-up 4-year follow-up mhy_upps_score <- fread(here(wd,"datas/5.1/core/mental-health/mh_y_upps.csv")) names(mhy_upps_score) # 统计每一项缺失值 mhy_upps_score %>% summarise(missing_sum = across(ends_with("_nm"), ~sum(.x, na.rm = T))) -> upps_miss_sum mhy_upps_score %>% drop_na() %>% # 去掉缺失值 group_by(src_subject_id) %>% # 按被试号分组 filter(n() == 3) %>% # 保留有三次数据的 filter(src_subject_id %in% sub_id$src_subject_id) %>% # 2463选择有3期Idp的人 select(src_subject_id,eventname,!ends_with(c("_y","_nm","_nt"))) %>% # 选择需要的列 ungroup() %>% # 取消分组 mutate( across(where(is.numeric), .fns = list(std = scale), .names = "{.fn}_{.col}")) %>% # 标准化 left_join(fread(here(wd,"temp/4年随访皮层厚度.csv")), by=c("src_subject_id","eventname")) %>% # 与皮层厚度数据合并 mutate(age = scale(interview_age/12), across(.cols = c(src_subject_id,sex), .fns = list(id = ~ as.integer(factor(.x,levels = unique(.x)))), .names = "{.fn}_{.col}") ) %>% # 性别和被试号转换数值型 年龄标准化 relocate(c(age,sex,id_src_subject_id,id_sex), .after = eventname) %>% # 调整列的位置 fwrite(here(wd,"temp/mhy_upps_score.csv")) # 写入文件 mhy_upps_score <- fread(here(wd,"temp/mhy_upps_score.csv")) mhy_upps_score t <- cor(mhy_upps_score$std_upps_y_ss_lack_of_perseverance, mhy_upps_score$smri_thick_cdk_mean) # 相关系数 ggplot(mhy_upps_score, aes(x = smri_thick_cdk_mean , y = std_upps_y_ss_lack_of_perseverance, color = sex)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) + facet_wrap(~eventname) # 分性别 看3期变化趋势 mlm_fit <- nlme::lme(smri_thick_cdk_mean ~ age + id_sex + std_upps_y_ss_negative_urgency + age:std_upps_y_ss_negative_urgency, random = ~ 1 | id_src_subject_id, method = "ML", data = mhy_upps_score, control = lmeControl(opt = "optim")) mlm_fit # 线性混合效应模型 summary(mlm_fit) gee_fit <- geeglm(smri_thick_cdk_mean ~ age + id_sex + std_upps_y_ss_lack_of_perseverance + age:std_upps_y_ss_lack_of_perseverance, id = id_src_subject_id, data = mhy_upps_score, std.err = "san.se", corstr = "exchangeable", family = "gaussian") gee_fit # 广义估计方程模型 summary(gee_fit) 8.3.4 CBCL 父母评价儿童行为量表 8.3.4.1 cbcl 量表显著的挺多 # Summary Score(s) Annually since Baseline mhy_cbcl_score <- fread(here(wd,"datas/5.1/core/mental-health/mh_p_cbcl.csv")) names(mhy_cbcl_score) # 统计每一项缺失值 mhy_cbcl_score %>% summarise(missing_sum = across(ends_with("_nm"), ~sum(.x, na.rm = T))) -> cbcl_miss_sum mhy_cbcl_score %>% #### drop_na() %>% # 差一步去掉缺失值 根据 std_cbcl_scr_syn_totprob_nm 列 #### #filter(eventname = 4_year) %>% # 保留有三次数据的 filter(eventname == "baseline_year_1_arm_1"| eventname == "2_year_follow_up_y_arm_1"| eventname == "4_year_follow_up_y_arm_1") %>% # 保留有三次数据的 group_by(src_subject_id) %>% # 按被试号分组 filter(n() == 3) %>% # 保留三期subjects ungroup() %>% # 取消分组 filter(src_subject_id %in% sub_id$src_subject_id) %>% # 2611 选择有3期Idp的人 select(src_subject_id,eventname, !ends_with(c("_t","_p","_m","_1","_2"))) %>% # 选择需要的列 mutate( across(where(is.numeric), .fns = list(std = scale), .names = "{.fn}_{.col}"),.keep = "unused") %>% # 标准化 left_join(fread(here(wd,"temp/4年随访皮层厚度.csv")), by=c("src_subject_id","eventname")) %>% # 与皮层厚度数据合并 mutate(age = scale(interview_age/12), across(.cols = c(src_subject_id,sex), .fns = list(id = ~ as.integer(factor(.x,levels = unique(.x)))), .names = "{.fn}_{.col}") ) %>% # 性别和被试号转换数值型 年龄标准化 relocate(c(age,sex,id_src_subject_id,id_sex), .after = eventname) %>% # 调整列的位置 fwrite(here(wd,"temp/mhy_cbcl_score.csv")) # 写入文件 mhy_cbcl_score <- fread(here(wd,"temp/mhy_cbcl_score.csv")) #读取文件 mhy_cbcl_score t <- cor(mhy_cbcl_score[,7:46]) %>% as.data.frame() # 相关系数 ggplot(mhy_cbcl_score, aes(x = std_cbcl_scr_syn_internal_r , y = smri_thick_cdk_mean)) + geom_line(aes(color = src_subject_id))+ scale_color_discrete(guide="none") + #geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) #facet_wrap(~eventname) # 分性别 看3期变化趋势 mlm_fit <- nlme::lme(smri_thick_cdk_mean ~ age + id_sex + std_cbcl_scr_syn_aggressive_r + age:std_cbcl_scr_syn_aggressive_r, random = ~ 1 | id_src_subject_id, method = "ML", data = mhy_cbcl_score, control = lmeControl(opt = "optim")) mlm_fit # 线性混合效应模型 summary(mlm_fit) gee_fit <- geeglm(smri_thick_cdk_mean ~ age + id_sex + std_cbcl_scr_syn_aggressive_r + age:std_cbcl_scr_syn_aggressive_r, id = id_src_subject_id, data = mhy_cbcl_score, std.err = "san.se", corstr = "exchangeable", family = "gaussian") gee_fit # 广义估计方程模型 summary(gee_fit) 8.3.5 ksads_ss 急性症状量表 8.3.5.1 需要整理一下列变量和对应诊断疾病的名称 ####Website #### eg：ksads_19_892_t ~ Alcohol Use Disorder Alcohol Use Disorder Past # logical value Annually since Baseline mhy_ksads_score <- fread(here(wd, "/datas/5.1/core/mental-health/mh_y_ksads_cd.csv")) names(mhy_ksads_score)
